alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 4:14PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 530 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 414 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Bernardino, Fontana, Ontario, Rialto, Redlands, Lake Arrowhead, I-15 Through The Cajon Pass, Rancho Cucamonga and Upland. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
